Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
International Typographical Union, Local 6, Journal of Commerce Chapel
International Typographical Union. Local 6 (New York, N.Y.). Journel of Commerce Chapel
WAG.276
0.25 Linear Feet in 2 folders
1873-1962 The International Typographical Union (ITU) was a trade union for the printing trade, founded in 1852. This collection consists of a reproduction of a membership ledger for one of the shops within the ITU Local 6. 1
Historical/Biographical Note
The International Typographical Union (ITU) was a trade union for the printing trade for newspapers and other media, founded in 1852. The ITU merged with the Communications Workers of America in 1987.
Conditions Governing Use
The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1873-1962, are expected to enter the public domain in 2083.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1980.015.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; International Typographical Union, Local 6, Journal of Commerce Chapel; WAG 276; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of a reproduction of a membership ledger for one of the shops within the ITU Local 6. The ledger contains names of members, the dates they joined and left the union, each member's department or position, and other remarks.
